text: Rainbow jersey The women's time trial was part of the 2011 UCI Para-cycling Track World Championships, held in Montichiari, Italy, in March 2011. Cyclists classified as C1, C2, C4 and C5 (locomotor disability) rode a 500 m time trial, while Tandem-B (visual impairment) rode a 1 km time trial. ==Medalists== There were no medals awarded in the classification C1 event, as there was only one contestant. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left" |- align="center" | bgcolor=efefef|Class||width=200 bgcolor=gold|Gold||width=200 bgcolor=silver|Silver|| width=200 bgcolor=CC9966|Bronze |- |C2 |Qi Tang '''' |Bianbian Sun '''' |Allison Jones '''' |- |C4 |Jianping Ruan '''' |Susan Powell '''' |Yaping Ye '''' |- |C5 |Sarah Storey '''' |Ju Fang Zhou '''' |Jennifer Schuble '''' |- |B |Stephanie Morton, Felicity Johnson '''' |Helen Scott, Aileen McGlynn '''' |Sonia Waddell, Jayne Parsons '''' |} ==C1== The Final was held on 13 March.Women's 500m Time Trial C1 - Results, Union Cycliste Internationale (UCI) *C1 - locomotor disability: Neurological, or amputation ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank!! |Name !! Nation !! Time |- | 1 ||align=left| Jayme Paris ||align=left| || 47.236 |} ==C2== The Final was held on 13 March.Women's 500m Time Trial C2 - Results , Official website of the 2011 UCI Para-cycling Track World Championships *C2 - locomotor disability: Neurological, decrease in muscle strength, or amputation ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !
